title: Elderly man killed after being hit by train at Tejgaon
body: An elderly man, whose identity could not be confirmed immediately, was killed after being struck by a train at Babulbagh Intersection of Tejgaon in Dhaka on Saturday night. According to the police and witnesses, the man, around 60, was walking along the railway tracks when a train heading toward Kamalapur hit him. He died on the spot. People of the area took him to the emergency department of Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead at 1:45am on Sunday. Mohammad Abu Raihan, who helped bring the victim to the hospital, said that the accident occurred suddenly while the man was walking on the railway track. Inspector Mohammad Faruk, in charge of the DMCH police outpost, said that the body had been kept at the hospital morgue for an autopsy. The Dhaka railway police station has been informed for further investigation.
